/// @dev Usde to make sure both parties are confirming escrow terms before buyer can deposit any funds
/// @dev Setting the NONCE and the WALLER address at contract creation

/// @dev Using the block.timestamp and the NONCE to get a fairely unique number that will be used to assign the escrow tx an ID

UpdateEscrowConditions(uint64,uint8).details: Only the owner/admin of the contract is able to call this funtion

params._newStatus: the new status of the escrow (zero based index of the EscrowStatus enum)

buyerConfirmAgreement(uint64).details: only the buyer can call this function

buyerDeposit(uint64).details: Only the buyer can call this function after making sure both parties are agreeing to the terms of the escrowThe balance of the buyer is checked and the amount of the escrow is also checked

params._id: The _id returned from escrowInit() function call which is now the escrow transaction id

buyerWithdraw(uint64).details: only the buyer can call this function

constructor.details: Setting the NONCE and the WALLER address at contract creation

escrowInit(uint8,address,address,uint256.details: Anybody can call this function, but the buyer and the seller must confirm for the escrow to initiate.

params._buyer: address of the buyer of the escrow
params._escrowReleaseDate: set to 0 if type is AGREEMENT_BASED, and with Unix Epoch of the escrow end date if type is TIME_BASED
params._escrowType: escrow type, 0 for AGREEMENT_BASED and 1 for TIME_BASED
params._seller: address of the seller of the escrow

returns._0: _id of the created escrow transaction, which will be used to call other functions

getEscrowID().details: This function is used to get the ID when testing the contract

getEscrowInfo(uint64).details: Escrow should exist for the function to work properly

getRandomNum().details: Using the block.timestamp and the NONCE to get a fairely unique number that will be used to assign the escrow tx an ID

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

partiesAgreement(uint64).details: After both parties call this function, the status of the transaction will change to EscrowStatus.WAITING_PAYMENT, so the buyer can proceed to buyerDeposit()

params._id: The _id returned from escrowInit() function call which is now the escrow transaction id

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

sellerWithdraw(uint64).details: only the seller is able to call this function, only when the buyer confirms delivery in case of AGREEMENT_BASED, or escrow period ends in case of TIME_BASED

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

updateEscrowAmount(uint64,uint256).details: Only the owner/admin of the contract is able to call this funtion

params._newAmount: the new amount that will be changed to, in wei

UpdateEscrowConditions(uint64,uint8).notice: onlyOwner function that can be called in case of a dispute arises so the admin will be able to make the escrow transation complete so the seller can withdraw it, or will make it BUYER_DISPUTE so the buyer will be able to get a refund

buyerConfirmAgreement(uint64).notice: If escrow type is AGREEMENT_BASED, the buyer will need to call this function if he/she are happy with the seller delivery, so the seller will be able to withdraw the escrow amount

buyerDeposit(uint64).notice: Buyer calls this function after he/she confirms the terms of the escrow with the seller

buyerWithdraw(uint64).notice: Buyer can call this function in case a dispute happened and the admin approved the authenticity of the buyer claims

escrowInit(uint8,address,address,uint256.notice: This function will initiate a new escrow with essential details of the escrow

getBalance().notice: Get the total available balance of the WALLET address

getEscrowID().notice: Get the ID of the last created escrow.

getEscrowInfo(uint64).notice: Get information about any given escrow if found

getRandomNum().notice: Getting random number to be used to generate a random escrow id.

partiesAgreement(uint64).notice: Buyer and Seller must call this function if they are agreeing to the terms of the contract

sellerWithdraw(uint64).notice: Seller will need to call this function to withdraw the funds of the escrow

updateEscrowAmount(uint64,uint256).notice: onlyOwner function that can be called in case of making a mistake from the buyer when setting the escrow for the first time
